Author: Meyse#0952
Content: is jumblr really as easy as it seems? lets forget backend for a second. In the frontend I basically would need 2 addressess where i hold the prkeys for? Send some coin to the deposit address and the coins will be jumblrd to the destination address. Is this right?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i tried to make the api as easy to use as possible, how the addresses are managed is up to the caller.nothing is saved on disk (other than the ztx) so restart the daemon and no record of what you jumblred

Author: Meyse#0952
Content: thats cool, im doodling an easy to use gui for this

Author: Meyse#0952
Content: im wondering if theres a case if people would want to look back at some overview or status of what they jumblrd in a gui

Author: Meyse#0952
Content: so if i were to create a new seed with agama for example, i can use all of these addressess of different coins to jumblr all those different coins?

Author: Meyse#0952
Content: or are there limitations, some coins cant be jumblred?

Author: Meyse#0952
Content: or there needs to be a mm available in kmd for these coins?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: jumblr only works with KMD, we need to aggregate all the jumblr activity

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no need for mm or any other party

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: single party tumbler

Author: Meyse#0952
Content: ah alright, so if i wanted to "jumblr" other coins, i would need to swap them to kmd first and then get the jumblr process started

Author: Meyse#0952
Content: in this whitepaper https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/komodo/wiki/JUMBLR-Whitepaper it says there is a btc layer, which does the swapping to kmd automatically

Author: chinmaydshah#6404
Content: @Mylo thanks for the details. One more question. Who assigns the notary role? Meaning who enforces the results of a notary election?

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
@chinmaydshah it's in the komodo code
https://github.com/jl777/komodo/blob/master/src/komodo_notary.h

Author: chinmaydshah#6404
Content: Notaries are hard coded?

Author: chinmaydshah#6404
Content: Jl777 committed those so I guess they do the final assignment

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: in the current design, yes

Author: chinmaydshah#6404
Content: Or whoever can commit to it

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: or whom ever can fork and get more followers than the initial repo

Author: chinmaydshah#6404
Content: Lol ye

Author: chinmaydshah#6404
Content: I guess that's fine bcz if they assume control of it they lose community support

Author: chinmaydshah#6404
Content: But to be decentralized I guess this bit needs to be part of the protocol.. notary elections, nominations and winning. Easier said than done

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is a reason half the notaries win automatic spots

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that way we have half the notaries that will adopt the new version, especially if some of the existing notaries win spots in the elections. There were some people worried about notaries not updating to the new election results, but there is no need to worry with half the spots being existing notaries, at a minimum
